snippet: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand of New York and Wendy Long, her Republican challenger, went to Dartmouth College amid the hostility that followed the admission of women.
abstract: Incumbent Sen Kirsten Gillibrand of New York and Republican Wendy Long, running against each other with sharply different political views and understandings of the world, shared a path earlier in life; both women attended Dartmouth College in the tumultuous decade following the introduction of women to the campus in 1972.
lead_paragraph: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand of New York and Wendy Long, her Republican challenger, went to Dartmouth College amid the hostility that followed the admission of women.

headline.seo: Kirsten Gillibrand and Wendy Long, Dartmouth Alumnae, Vie for Senate Seat
headline.main: Two Paths Through Dartmouth Meet in a U.S. Senate Race
headline.print_headline: After Forging Paths At Mostly Male Dartmouth, Facing Off for the Senate
